basics.name: Nathan Lam
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: Senior Computer Engineering undergraduate student at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. Some of my interests include embedded systems, firmware development, and web development.

highlights: Researched a prototype proof-of-concept based on blockchain technology to define trust relationships through secured vehicle-to-vehicle communications
Developed autonomous robotic cars using LIDAR and the Zigbee wireless protocol capable of informing network traffic for collective decision-making
Simulated successful high-trust communications protocol and autonomous resilience against the injection of malicious inputs by rouge actors
Built data-logger web-server from scratch using the Django web framework to log data via UART on a Raspberry Pi into .csv files using Python scripts
Improved data collection efficiency and enabled instant data conversion
Designed and customized web interface using HTML5/CSS to create, edit, remove, or view logging data
Design and build an autonomous self-contained robotic vehicle capable of navigating through a previously unknown maze with the shortest time and path
Implement adaptive intelligence through positional/velocity controllers and a modified Flood Fill algorithm to reliably find the optimal route to the center of a maze
Design and implement firmware for highly distributed weather sensor network to analyze solar irradiance, pressure, humidity, and temperature patterns
Maintain/update data collection and storage infrastructure
Built application using OCR technology to convert scanned text captured by a digital camera into a digital format
Designed and programmed a low-cost, accurate, and reliable prototype weatherbox using environmental sensor modules to forecast weather patterns
Implemented continuous electrowetting automation and precise positional control for reconfigurable electronic devices using Galinstan
Eliminated manual actuation requirement and improved RF device prototyping

volunteer.summary: Taught kids (ages 3-11) how to swim, educated about ocean safety, First Aid/CPR Certification, and various community service projects.

highlights: Webmaster, IEEE-Eta Kappa Nu Honor Society, 2016-Present
Member, Golden Key International Honor Society, 2015-Present

awards.title: Manoa Chancellor's Scholarship
awards.summary: A maximum of 80 scholarships of $10,000 annually ($5,000/semester) will be awarded by the Office of Admissions to high-achieving Hawai ªi high school graduates.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.awarder: University of Hawaii College of Engineering
awards.summary: Awarded to students who earn a semester grade point average of 3.5 or higher based on 12 credits or more taken for a grade.

awards.title: 1st Place Division B Oahu Mathematics League Champions
awards.summary: OML is a mathematics competition league open to high schools statewide which include 32 schools (19 public, 13 private), including five Big Island schools who compete remotely.
